skillTree.localised_description:
In the shadowy depths of the Under-Empire, where darkness reigns and treachery thrives, there exists a blade whispered of only in the darkest corners of Skaven society: the Reaper of Night. Crafted from the very essence of shadows and honed with the tears of those who have fallen before it, this sinister weapon is wielded by none other than Nightlord Sneek, the cunning and ruthless lord of Clan Eshin.
	
	The Reaper of Night is no ordinary blade; its steel is imbued with the essence of the void, granting it an eerie, almost otherworldly presence. Its edge is as sharp as a serpent's fang, capable of slicing through armor and flesh alike with chilling ease. But it is not merely its physical attributes that make the Reaper of Night so feared—it carries with it a curse that taints the very souls of those it strikes down.
	
	Those struck by the blade find that all the skill and experience they could once call upon has been rendered naught, stolen from them by Nightlord Sneek and the weeping green toxins of the Reaper of Night.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.

skillTree.localised_description:
The Umbral Mantle, a cloak woven from the very fabric of darkness itself, serves as both armor and shroud for the enigmatic Nightlord Sneek, master of deception and lord of Clan Eshin. Crafted by the most skilled artisans of Clan Eshin, this cloak is more than mere fabric; it is a manifestation of shadows given form.
	
	Upon first glance, the Umbral Mantle appears as a simple cloak, its fabric as dark as the deepest abyss. Yet, when draped over Nightlord Sneek's wiry frame, it seems to come alive, embracing him in a veil of shifting darkness that obscures his form from prying eyes.
	
	The cloak possesses an uncanny ability to meld with the shadows, granting Nightlord Sneek the power to move unseen and unheard amidst the darkest of environs. Its magical properties render him virtually invisible to all but the keenest of senses, allowing him to stalk his prey with unparalleled stealth and precision.
	
	But the Umbral Mantle is more than just a tool of concealment; it is also a ward against harm. Woven into its very fibers are enchantments that deflect blades and arrows alike, offering Nightlord Sneek a measure of protection in the midst of battle.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: As it turns out, the more important the murder, the more likely they are to be carrying something worth 'appropriating'.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: By its very nature, being good at killing requires that you are equally adept at not dying.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

Enemy Hero action success chance: -15%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
With almost un-Skaven-like focus, Snikch moves unseen through the battlefield until the moment of murderous truth.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit remains hidden while firing.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: Nightlord Sneek creates a perplexing illusion, conjuring a duplicate of himself to fight alongside him. The illusion is so convincing, so lifelike, that even seasoned warriors find themselves momentarily baffled by the sight of two identical Skaven lords bearing down upon them. This doppelgänger is not merely a figment of Sneek's imagination; it possesses all of his skill, cunning, and ferocity.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

ui_effects.localised_text: Creates an image of Nightlord Sneek

skillTree.localised_description: Tucked into the net that holds his most precious weapons are three of Nightlord Sneek's prized concoctions - globes seething with the very energy of the Lore of Stealth. Unleashed, they tear through foes unlucky enough to be caught at the point of impact.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: A single Skaven Assassin can tip the balance of a battle with one precisely thrown warp star. Such efficiency of movement and effect is exactly what Nightlord Sneek demands from his underlings.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for all Clan Eshin units
	(all armies)
Recruitment cost: -15% for all Clan Eshin units
Upkeep: -15% for all Clan Eshin units

skillTree.localised_description: The Lords of Decay pursue their own nefarious plots and schemes, manipulating the lesser clans and assassinating those who pose them the slightest threat.

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Open diplomatic relations with all members of the Council of Thirteen.

skillTree.localised_description: There has never been a foe that Nightlord Sneek cannot outfox, tricking enemy after enemy until they all lay dead before him on the battlefield. Often, the fight is won before the first warp star has been thrown into battle.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

effects.description:
Attribute: Causes Fear when ambushing
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: Suddenly, there are two identical forms of Nightlord Sneek prowling the battlefield, each as dangerous and elusive as the other. These mirages of Sneek move with synchronized precision, their movements fluid and seamless as they coordinate attacks and confound adversaries. It becomes impossible to discern which is the true Nightlord Sneek and which is but a shadowy reflection, leaving enemies paralyzed with uncertainty.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

ui_effects.localised_text: Creates an image of Nightlord Sneek

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
Although precision in missile combat is something that can be learned, this one was born with a high degree of natural talent.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The forest teaches a warrior not only when to fire but where, which makes a bigger difference.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
Sneek's appearance on the battlefield can freeze even the most stalwart of foes, driven briefly mad by the vile magics of the Eshin.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Clanrats units

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing exactly where and when to strike is essential when fielding fiendish, potentially battle-winning plague-weapons.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and thread…

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Gutter Runners, Night Runners, Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +20% for Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Weapon Team, Doom-Flayers, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Infantry: +5 for Doomwheel, Doom-Flayers and Warp-Grinders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Weapon Team, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Weapon Team, Doom-Flayer, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere – even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle – spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

backgroundSkills.localised_description:
Sneek's mastery of stealth and infiltration is unparalleled among the Skaven, earning him a feared reputation both within the Under-Empire and beyond. He moves through the shadows like a ghost, striking swiftly and silently before disappearing once more into the darkness.
	
	As the Nightlord of Clan Eshin, Sneek commands legions of assassins and spies, using their skills to further his own ambitions and undermine his rivals within Skaven society. His loyalty lies only with himself, and he is not above betraying even his closest allies if it serves his own interests.
	
	But it is not just his skill in the arts of assassination that makes Nightlord Sneek so formidable—it is his mastery of manipulation and deception. He is a master tactician, capable of orchestrating elaborate schemes that leave his enemies bewildered and outmaneuvered.

effects.description:
Ability: "Out of the Darkness"
	(all units in army)

enabled_if: Unit is attacking rear or flank

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.
